text: It's a balance between searching in your editor / IDE and understanding the structure of the code so knowing where to look. As you work more with the code, you move progressively from the former to the latter. A good place to start to understand all the data available are the classes in BFLW's bettingresources.py script.

text:
Alright guys, anyone know what I'm doing wrong with my time_range filter for list_cleared_orders:

```    trading = betfair_login()
    cleared_orders = trading.betting.list_cleared_orders(
            event_type_ids=["7"],
            settled_date_range=filters.time_range(
                datetime.utcnow(), 
                datetime.utcnow() - timedelta(days=90)
        )
    )```

text: :pensive:
cheers mate

Hey guys. A couple of days ago I tried to login to the API for the first time. I am using Python on windows and used XCA to make the certificates. At the moment of logging in, using the following code, I get an error:

`trading = betfairlightweight.APIClient(username=my_username,`
                                          `password=my_password,`
                                          `app_key=my_app_key,`
                                          `certs=certs_path)`
`trading.login()`

The error I get is (this is only the last part of the error code, it is way bigger than this):
`APIError: None` 
`Params: None` 
`Exception: HTTPSConnectionPool(host='<http://identitysso-cert.betfair.com|identitysso-cert.betfair.com>', port=443): Max retries exceeded with url: /api/certlogin (Caused by SSLError(SSLError(9, '[SSL] PEM lib (_ssl.c:4022)')))`

I've heard from others that it might have to do with the certificates, but I redid the full process like it is prescribed on the manual. Is there anyone with any tips/followup questions?

text:
yeah, others have had that issue too <@U029XDZ22KB>, I should change the tutorial, sorry for the confusion. try to swap it out for this:

```with open('credentials.json') as f:
    cred = json.load(f)
    my_username = cred['username']
    my_password = cred['password']
    my_app_key  = cred['app_key']
 
 
trading = APIClient(my_username, my_password, app_key=my_app_key, lightweight=True)
trading.login_interactive()```

elements.text: yeah, others have had that issue too
, I should change the tutorial, sorry for the confusion. try to swap it out for this:

with open('credentials.json') as f:
    cred = json.load(f)
    my_username = cred['username']
    my_password = cred['password']
    my_app_key  = cred['app_key']
 
 
trading = APIClient(my_username, my_password, app_key=my_app_key, lightweight=True)
trading.login_interactive()
